trans-unit.source: Validate whether the specified template is syntactically correct and would be accepted by the Azure Resource Manager.
trans-unit.target: Validate whether the specified template is syntactically correct and would be accepted by the Azure Resource Manager.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="953bb73d-e38c-4c29-bd35-1b2d5b37c5ce#bk_common" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Common parameters and headers</link> for headers and parameters that are used by all requests related to template deployments.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="953bb73d-e38c-4c29-bd35-1b2d5b37c5ce#bk_common" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Common parameters and headers</link> for headers and parameters that are used by all requests related to template deployments.

trans-unit.source: Replace {resource-group-name} with the name of the resource group in which the resources would be deployed.
trans-unit.target: Replace {resource-group-name} with the name of the resource group in which the resources would be deployed.

trans-unit.source: Replace {deployment-name} with the name that you would use for the deployment.
trans-unit.target: Replace {deployment-name} with the name that you would use for the deployment.

trans-unit.source: To validate a template deployment, the template and the deployment parameters can be provided directly in the request or from a file stored in Azure storage.
trans-unit.target: To validate a template deployment, the template and the deployment parameters can be provided directly in the request or from a file stored in Azure storage.

trans-unit.source: See the example later in this page for defining the template and the deployment parameters directly in the request.
trans-unit.target: See the example later in this page for defining the template and the deployment parameters directly in the request.

trans-unit.source: The following example shows using a link to a template file and a link to a parameters file in storage:
trans-unit.target: The following example shows using a link to a template file and a link to a parameters file in storage:

trans-unit.source: Specifies a collection of information about the template deployment.
trans-unit.target: Specifies a collection of information about the template deployment.

trans-unit.source: Specifies a collection of information about the template file.
trans-unit.target: Specifies a collection of information about the template file.

trans-unit.source: Either the templateLink element or the template element must be used, but not both.
trans-unit.target: Either the templateLink element or the template element must be used, but not both.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the URI that is used to locate the template file in storage.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the URI that is used to locate the template file in storage.

trans-unit.source: The blob must be publicly accessible.
trans-unit.target: The blob must be publicly accessible.

trans-unit.source: This element is required if the templateLink element is used.
trans-unit.target: This element is required if the templateLink element is used.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the version of the template.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the version of the template.

trans-unit.source: The value must match the value of the contentVersion element in the template file.
trans-unit.target: The value must match the value of the contentVersion element in the template file.

trans-unit.source: This element is required if the templateLink element is used.
trans-unit.target: This element is required if the templateLink element is used.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the mode that is used to deploy resources.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the mode that is used to deploy resources.

trans-unit.source: In Incremental mode, resources are deployed without deleting existing resources that are not included in the template.
trans-unit.target: In Incremental mode, resources are deployed without deleting existing resources that are not included in the template.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the collection of information about the parameters file.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the collection of information about the parameters file.

trans-unit.source: Either the parametersLink element or the parameters element can be used, but not both.
trans-unit.target: Either the parametersLink element or the parameters element can be used, but not both.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the URI that is used to locate the parameters file in storage.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the URI that is used to locate the parameters file in storage.

trans-unit.source: The blob must be publicly accessible.
trans-unit.target: The blob must be publicly accessible.

trans-unit.source: This element is required if the parametersLink element is used.
trans-unit.target: This element is required if the parametersLink element is used.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the version of the deployment parameters.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the version of the deployment parameters.

trans-unit.source: The value must match the value of the contentVersion element in the parameter file.
trans-unit.target: The value must match the value of the contentVersion element in the parameter file.

trans-unit.source: This element is required if the parametersLink element is used.
trans-unit.target: This element is required if the parametersLink element is used.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the JSON definition for the template.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the JSON definition for the template.

trans-unit.source: Either the templateLink element or the template element must be used, but not both.
trans-unit.target: Either the templateLink element or the template element must be used, but not both.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the template schema, see <link xlink:href="d9c49be6-a91f-4024-94b6-9275ecb299b9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure Resource Manager Template Schema</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about the template schema, see <link xlink:href="d9c49be6-a91f-4024-94b6-9275ecb299b9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure Resource Manager Template Schema</link>.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the name and value pairs that define the deployment parameters for the template.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the name and value pairs that define the deployment parameters for the template.

trans-unit.source: Either the parametersLink element or the parameters element is used, but not both.
trans-unit.target: Either the parametersLink element or the parameters element is used, but not both.

trans-unit.source: For more information about template parameters, see <link xlink:href="d9c49be6-a91f-4024-94b6-9275ecb299b9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure Resource Manager Template Schema</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about template parameters, see <link xlink:href="d9c49be6-a91f-4024-94b6-9275ecb299b9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure Resource Manager Template Schema</link>.

trans-unit.target: The following example shows the template and parameters defined directly in the request:

trans-unit.source: The following example shows the response for a template deployment that gets its files from storage:
trans-unit.target: The following example shows the response for a template deployment that gets its files from storage:

trans-unit.source: Specifies the identifying URL of the deployment.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the identifying URL of the deployment.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the name that would be used for the deployment.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the name that would be used for the deployment.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the URI for a file in storage.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the URI for a file in storage.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the version of the file contents.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the version of the file contents.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the type of the specified value.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the type of the specified value.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the value that is assigned to the element.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the value that is assigned to the element.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the mode that is used to deploy resources.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the mode that is used to deploy resources.

trans-unit.source: A resource may supply its own provisioning string that represents an intermediate state, such as <languageKeyword>Creating</languageKeyword> or <languageKeyword>Deleting</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: A resource may supply its own provisioning string that represents an intermediate state, such as <languageKeyword>Creating</languageKeyword> or <languageKeyword>Deleting</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the time that the operation ran.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the time that the operation ran.

trans-unit.source: Specifies a unique identifier for the deployment that can be used to find associated events in the event service.
trans-unit.target: Specifies a unique identifier for the deployment that can be used to find associated events in the event service.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the namespace of the resource provider.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the namespace of the resource provider.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the type of the resource or resource provider.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the type of the resource or resource provider.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the name of a resource.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the name of a resource.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the list of geo-locations where the resource is available.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the list of geo-locations where the resource is available.

trans-unit.source: The following example shows the response for a template and deployment parameters defined directly in the request:
trans-unit.target: The following example shows the response for a template and deployment parameters defined directly in the request:

trans-unit.source: The following information about a template deployment is validated:
trans-unit.target: The following information about a template deployment is validated:

trans-unit.source: The subscription exists, is enabled, and not undergoing migration.
trans-unit.target: The subscription exists, is enabled, and not undergoing migration.

trans-unit.source: All required fields are present and are below the maximum length limit.
trans-unit.target: All required fields are present and are below the maximum length limit.

trans-unit.source: The location of a resource group is the same as when it was created.
trans-unit.target: The location of a resource group is the same as when it was created.

trans-unit.source: The names of resource groups and resources only contain characters that follow syntax described in RFC 3986.
trans-unit.target: The names of resource groups and resources only contain characters that follow syntax described in RFC 3986.

trans-unit.source: If dependencies exist, they must be part of the template.
trans-unit.target: If dependencies exist, they must be part of the template.

trans-unit.source: If errors exist, they are returned in the response body.
trans-unit.target: If errors exist, they are returned in the response body.

trans-unit.source: If many errors are found, they may not all be returned.
trans-unit.target: If many errors are found, they may not all be returned.

trans-unit.source: If this happens, fix the errors that are returned and then run the validation operation again.
trans-unit.target: If this happens, fix the errors that are returned and then run the validation operation again.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the structure of a template, see <link xlink:href="d9c49be6-a91f-4024-94b6-9275ecb299b9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure Resource Manager Template Schema</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about the structure of a template, see <link xlink:href="d9c49be6-a91f-4024-94b6-9275ecb299b9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure Resource Manager Template Schema</link>.
